text: I like to dry brine Turkey it's just
like a wet brine except you don't need a
giant bucket and gallons of water
instead you just rub the whole bird with
salt I have a 14 pound bird here six
tablespoons of salt measured out two
tablespoons go into the cavity and then
another quarter cup that's four more
tablespoons on the outside of the bird
and you really want this everywhere
transfer the bird to a rimmed baking
sheet and let it hang out in the fridge
uncovered for about 24 hours this bird
has been in the fridge and now give it a
thorough rinse under cool running water
just to rinse off all of that excess
salt Pat the skin dry half a stick of
butter it gets rubbed all over the
exterior make sure that butter is
everywhere the outside gets salt first
and pepper the bottom of the bird
important to season here
you've got all this thigh meat the wings
and that beautiful dark meat just along
the spine all that's left to do is tuck
the wings and tie up the drums this goes
to a roasting pan lined with the wire
rack let it hang out for about an hour
at room temperature so that it's not
cold when it goes into the oven and that
oven should be preheated to 425 degrees
for 30 minutes and then you'll turn the
oven down to 350 and continue roasting
until he registers 165 degrees on a meat
thermometer and that'll take another
hour and a half to two and a half hours
look at our beautiful bird perfectly
roasted and golden brown I like to
decorate with fruits and herbs beautiful
pomegranates here citrus fruit gorgeous
sage in this beautiful time and this
beautiful roasted turkey is ready for
your Thanksgiving table
you
